verse.roman:
mahāmātra tvayā bhadra
raṅga-dvāry upanīyatām
dvipaḥ kuvalayāpīḍo
jahi tena mamāhitau

synonyms: mahā-mātra—O elephant-keeper; tvayā—by you; bhadra—my good man; raṅga—of the arena; dvāri—to the doorway; upanīyatām—should be brought; dvipaḥ—the elephant; kuvalayāpīḍaḥ—named Kuvalayāpīḍa; jahi—destroy; tena—with that (elephant); mama—my; ahitau—enemies.
translation: You, elephant-keeper, my good man, should position the elephant Kuvalayāpīḍa at the entrance to the wrestling arena and have him kill my two enemies.
